smartgov.core.simulation

Class SimulationRuntime

  • java.lang.Object
    • smartgov.core.simulation.SimulationRuntime

  • public class SimulationRuntime
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to run the simulation and update the context elements.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Runs the simulation until stop is called.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a simulation is already running.

      • start

        public void start(int ticks)
        Runs the simulation for the specified number of ticks.
        Parameters:
        ticks - number of ticks to run
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a simulation is already running.

      • pause

        public void pause()
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Pause the simulation, if it is running.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no simulation is running.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • resume

        public void resume()
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Resume a paused simulation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no simulation is running or if it's not paused.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop a running simulation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no simulation is running.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Check if the simulation is still running. Notice that a paused simulation is considered as running.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the simulation is running.

      • step

        public void step()
        Performs a step, if the current simulation is running and paused.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no simulation is running or if it's not paused.

      • getTickCount

        public int getTickCount()
        Gets current tick count.
        Returns:
        current tick count

      • getTickDuration

        public double getTickDuration()
        Gets tick duration, in seconds.

        The tick duration represents the real amount of time a tick represents, and so can be used to compute speeds for example.

        Returns:
        current tick duration

      • setTickDuration

        public void setTickDuration(double tickDuration)
        Sets tick duration, in seconds.

        Default value is set to 1.0.

        Parameters:
        tickDuration - new tick duration

      • getTickDelay

        public double getTickDelay()
        Gets tick delay, in microseconds.

        The tick delay represents the duration between each simulation steps, in the meaning of real time simulation visualization.

        When set to 0 (as it is by default) or to a negative value, the simulation runs as fast as possible without any delay.

        Returns:
        tick delay, in microseconds

      • setTickDelay

        public void setTickDelay(long tickDelay)
        Sets tick delay. Default value is set to 0.
        Parameters:
        tickDelay - new tick delay

      • getClock

        public Clock getClock()
        Current simulation clock
        Returns:
        simulation clock

      • getSimulationThread

        public java.lang.Thread getSimulationThread()
        Returns the Thread in which the simulation is currently running. A new Thread is created each time the simulation starts.
        Returns:
        current simulation thread

      • waitUntilSimulatioEnd

        public void waitUntilSimulatioEnd()
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Blocking function to wait until the simulation has stopped.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while sleeping
